resources.string: The rise time is when the sun or moon fully appears above the horizon.
The set time is when the sun or moon completely disappears below the horizon.
The dawn is when the first visible light of the day appears before sunrise.
The dusk is the darkest stage of twilight before the last visible light disappears.
Upcoming alerts, tap here to see them.
No data available for this day.
Not enough hourly data available to display a chart for this day.
What the temperature feels like, as a result of humidity, wind and/or sunlight.
Difference between the outside temperature and a reference comfortable temperature used to estimate heating energy requirements
Difference between the outside temperature and a reference comfortable temperature used to estimate cooling energy requirements
Deviation from %s average maximum temperature for this location
Deviation from %s average minimum temperature for this location
Wind speed is measured by averaging wind speeds over a period of time. Gusts are sudden bursts of wind typically lasting under 20 seconds.
The UV index measures the strength of the sun’s ultraviolet radiation. The higher it is, the greater and faster it can cause sunburn, skin cancer and eye damage.
The exact time to burn depends on the altitude, the presence of reflective ground like water or snow, your skin type, and the use of sunscreen.
Air quality index (AQI) is a scale designed to help you understand how polluted the air is in a particular area, and the potential risks to your health.

The scale used in this app is based on World Health Organization recommendations, rather than local regulations, to have meaningful categories, and make it easier to compare pollution levels between countries.
The air quality is ideal for most individuals; enjoy your normal outdoor activities.
The air quality is generally acceptable for most individuals. However, sensitive groups may experience minor to moderate symptoms from long-term exposure.
The air has reached a high level of pollution and is unhealthy for sensitive groups. Reduce time spent outside if you are feeling symptoms such as difficulty breathing or throat irritation.
Health effects can be immediately felt by sensitive groups. Healthy individuals may experience difficulty breathing and throat irritation with prolonged exposure. Limit outdoor activity.

Health effects will be immediately felt by sensitive groups and should avoid outdoor activity. Healthy individuals are likely to experience difficulty breathing and throat irritation; consider staying indoors and rescheduling outdoor activities.
Any exposure to the air, even for a few minutes, can lead to serious health effects on everybody. Avoid outdoor activities.

Main sources are combustion processes (e.g. power plants, indoor heating, car exhausts, wildfires), mechanical processes (e.g. construction, mineral dust, agriculture) and biological particles (e.g. pollen, mold, bacteria, viruses).
Main sources are burning processes of sulfur-containing fuel in industry, transportation and power plants.
Main sources are fuel burning processes, such as those used in industry and transportation.
Ozone is created in a chemical reaction between atmospheric oxygen, nitrogen oxides, carbon monoxide and organic compounds, in the presence of sunlight.
Typically originates from incomplete combustion of carbon fuels, such as that which occurs in car engines and power plants.
Begins in the evening and lasts until dawn next day
Relative humidity, more commonly known just as humidity, is the percentage of water vapour present in the air compared to the maximum amount that the air can hold at a given temperature.
Dew point is what the temperature would need to be cooled to in order to achieve a relative humidity of %s.

Atmospheric pressure is the downward pressure exerted by the earth’s atmosphere. This app uses mean sea level pressure (MSLP) to allow easier comparison of pressure from places with different altitudes.

Significant, rapid changes in pressure are used to predict changes in the weather. For example, a drop in pressure can mean that rain or snow is on the way, and rising pressure can mean that weather will improve. Abnormal atmospheric pressure may cause headaches, joint pain, fatigue and other effects.
Visibility tells you how far away you can clearly see objects like buildings and hills. Visibility can be affected by precipitation, fog, dust, smoke or haze.
Cloud cover refers to the percentage of the sky obscured by clouds on average. The cloud cover is correlated to the sunshine duration.
This material has been modified from the original by %s mainly to compute or extrapolate missing data.
Source doesn’t support one of requested features
Invalid location, please delete it and re-add
Please wait a few seconds before retrying…
To workaround the limit, add your own API key.
On some weather data sources, you need to provide your own API key. If you already provided one, please double-check the API key you provided.
To use this source, you need to provide an API key.
Location list already contains this location with this forecast source.
You’re about to delete “%s” from your list of saved locations.
You’re about to delete this location from your list of saved locations.
You can swipe left to delete this item
Access location in background permission missing
Weather source failed to find a matching location
Make sure your search is spelled correctly and not too specific. Alternatively, you can try another location search source which may produce different results.
Open this location in another app
Toggle the data type selection menu
No app to share with found
Tap here to enable notifications about app updates.
Tap here to enable notifications about weather alerts, or decide later in Settings.

To use this feature, you need to grant the app permission to access your current location. It will only be shared with the selected weather sources. If you changed your mind, you can cancel the process and add a fixed location manually.

To allow weather refresh in the background to be made for the most recent current location known by Android, you need to set location permission to “Allow all the time”. If you don’t, weather will be refreshed based on the latest retrieved coordinates in the foreground, which can be outdated.
Tap on error messages with a question mark to get further help.
Invalid or incomplete data received from server
Change your forecast or air quality source so that times match.
This is usually a temporary error. If the error persists, please report an issue on GitHub.

Make sure you updated to latest version of the app. Server may be temporarily unavailable, in that case, please try again later. If the problem persists, please dump a crash log from debug settings, and report an issue on GitHub.

This can happen when you added your location in the Standard flavor of the app and then switched to the flavor with only libre network sources. Going back to the Standard flavor may solve this problem.
Either change the weather sources for this location, or delete and re-add this location.
Source hosted on a non-free network service not available in this version of the app

This occurs when you used a source hosted on a non-free network in the Standard version of the application and switched to the Freenet version with only sources hosted on free networks. Return to the Standard version, or change the source to resolve this issue.

You can input anything, but please pay attention to the length of the text. If you want to quote weather data, please use $ to reference the corresponding keyword.\n\nFor example, “Current weather is: $cw$.” will be displayed as “Current weather is: Clear sky.”.

Nighttime weather of today, tomorrow, …, 4 days later

Nighttime temperature of today, tomorrow, …, 4 days later (°C/°F)

Wallpaper animations are known to cause, among other things: high battery consumption; battery overheating; high memory consumption; degraded system responsiveness; Android system crash.
If you decide to enable them, you assume full responsibility for any problem that may arise, and no support will be provided.
By turning off background updates, you will no longer receive notifications of alerts or precipitation. Widgets won’t be refreshed until you open the app.

The background update process is lightweight: it only refreshes your first location at your select rate, and secondary locations only if you need them, once a day. It’s battery-efficient and should not exceed %d MB of data consumption a month.
Consider using a less frequent refresh rate rather than turning off background updates, otherwise tap “Continue” if you still want to proceed.
This is the first thing to try when you don’t receive notifications or widgets are not refreshing.
Some manufacturers have additional app restrictions that kill background services. The Don’t kill my app! website has info on how to fix it.
Allowed. You can add your current location as a location.
Please allow if you want to be able to add your current location as a location.
Enabled. App will be able to refresh weather data for your current location in background.
Please enable “Allow all the time” to have background refreshes for your current location.
Enabled. Device’s network provider will be used in priority and most of the time, but GPS can also be used as a fallback.
Enable “Use precise location” if you have trouble getting a location.
Default weather source for new locations, custom API keys, other source settings
Sources hosted on a non-free network service are not available in this version of the app. Tap here to learn more.
More weather sources may become available for your location after the first refresh.
Customize weather data sources used for this location
Must be an https URL ending with a /
Combines the best weather models for this location
Combines all weather models from this provider into a seamless prediction
Language, dark mode, icon pack, units
Always dark when app is in dark mode
Notifications of weather alerts, precipitations or forecast for the first location
Needed to notify about alerts, forecasts and app updates. %s
Notification time for the day’s forecast

Needed to show the notification widget. %s
Needed to notify about crash logs and failed weather updates. %s
Saves error logs to a file for sharing with the developers
Changes will take effect after restart
Tap to drag the list items to sort
Unavailable, enable animations in Android settings first
Running in background to keep updating
Expected to continue until at least %s
This Android version is no longer supported
Developer of the original project Geometric Weather
get weather information from Breezy Weather, including the coordinates of your locations, such as your current location if you added it

The Fire Danger Warning is Yellow and the fire risk is High.
The Fire Danger Warning is Red and the fire risk is Extreme.
